Name: Is there a distinct category of dual for verbal agreement with a dual subject?
Is non-agreement in number between the nominal subject and verbal predicate possible?
Comment: In 3Pl forms, the impersonal form is used.

Name: Can finite verbs agree in number with the nominal object?
Can an adnominal property word agree with the noun in case?
Example: suure-s järve-s;big-INE lake-INE;in a big lake;

Name: Are there cases that do not show agreement in terms of case?
Example: oma-n lapse-nke;own-GEN child-COM;with one's child;

Name: Can adpositions be used to mark core verbal arguments?
Can adpositions be used to mark non-core/oblique verbal arguments?
Example: Myö juoks-i-mmo silla-n alle;1PL run-PST-1PL bridge-GEN under;We ran under the bridge;

Name: Can non-finite clauses entail a special way for a core argument (S/A) marking?
Example: Muama-n kodi-h tul-duu rube-i-mmo yhtes pasta-ma-h;mother-GEN home-ILL come-PASS.PST.PTCP.PRT start-PST-1PL together bake-SUP-ILL;When mother came home we started to bake together;

Name: Can non-finite clauses entail a special way for a core argument (P) marking?
Do characteristics of object referent (topicality, animacy, definiteness) influence object marking?
Does object marking correlate with aspectuality?
Example: Muamo lämmit-ti päči-n;mother heat-PST.3SG oven-GEN;Mother heated up the oven;|Muamo lämmit-ti päčči-i;mother heat-PST.3SG oven-PRT;Mother was heating the oven;

Name: Does the marking of the object depend on the verb conjugation form?
Example: Ota avain!;take.IMP.2SG key.NOM;Take the key!;| Älä ota avain-du!;NEG.IMP.2SG take.IMP key-PRT;Don't take the key!;

Name: Is there differential subject marking?
Example: Leiby on stola-l;bread.NOM be.3SG table-ADE;The bread is on the table;|Stola-l on leibi-ä;table-ADE be.3SG bread-PRT;There is some bread on the table;

Name: Can S and A be conflated morphologically across clause boundaries, i.e. act as syntactic pivot?
Example: Tyttö näg-i mečä-s kondie-n da juoks-i iäres;girl.NOM see-PST.3SG forest-INE bear-GEN and run-PST.3SG away;The girl saw a bear in the forest and run away;

Name: Can S and P be conflated morphologically across clause boundaries, i.e. act as syntactic pivot?
Is there a grammatical device for habituality?
Is there a grammatical device for frequentative?
Example: juos-ta;run-INF;to run;|juokse-ndele-n;run-FRQ-1SG;I run around;

Name: Is there a grammatical device for progressivity?
Example: Ole-n kaččo-mas televiizoru-a;be-1SG watch-SUP.INE televizion-PRT;I am watching the TV;

Name: Is it common to use a verb in the present tense for future time reference?
Example: lähte-n Suome-h, osta-n piirua-du;go-1SG Finland-ILL buy-1SG pie-PRT;I'll go to Finland and buy a pie;

Name: Is there a grammatical device for immediate future?
Example: Ole-n lähte-mäs piha-le;be-1SG go-SUP.INE yard-ALL;I am going to the yard;

Name: Is there a grammatical device for pluperfect?
Example: Konzu havaču-i-n, ol-dih muu-t jo lähtie-tty muarja-h;when wake_up-PST-1SG be-IPS.PST other-PL already go-PASS.PST.PTCP berry-ILL;When I woke up, others had already left to pick berries;

Name: Can aspect be expressed overtly on the negative marker?
Can tense be expressed overtly on the negative marker?
Is there grammatical marking of mirativity?
Is there morphological marking on the verb dedicated to the expression of desire or wish?
Is there morphological marking for irrealis (e.g. hypothetical state of affairs)?
Example: Elä-zi-n kylä-s, gu vai sua-zi-n;live-COND-1SG village-INE, if only get-COND-1SG;I would live in a village if I only could;

Name: Are verbs marked in a specific mood in counterfactual conditional clauses?
Example: Gu ol-izi-t pasta-nuh piirua-n, syö-zi-n se-n;if be-COND-2SG bake-ACT.PST.PTCP pie-GEN eat-COND-1SG it-GEN;If  you would have baked a pie, I would eat it;

Name: Is there morphological marking on the verb dedicated to the expression of deontic necessity?
Is there morphological marking on the verb dedicated to the expression of epistemic possibility?
Example: anda-ne-n;give-POT-1SG;I probably give, come;

Name: Is there morphological marking on the verb dedicated to the expression of deontic possibility?
Is there morphological marking on the verb used to express indirect commands/wishes etc. directed to the 3Sg?
Example: anda-kkah;give-IMP.3PL;Let him/her give;

Name: Is there morphological marking on the verb used to express indirect commands/wishes etc. directed to the 1Sg?
Is it common to use the imperative/jussive in complement clauses introduced by predicates expressing wish/desire/will?
Is there morphological marking on the verb dedicated to the expression of apprehension?
Is there reflexive conjugation?
Example: Ota-mmos : ota-ttos;take-REFL.1SG : take-REFL.2SG;;
Comment: Verbs have a separate reflexive paradigm.

Name: Are there syntactically ditransitive verbs?
Can non-singular 2nd and 3rd person have the same person/number marking or morphosyntactic treatment?
Can an impersonal (or passive) form be used instead of a finite plural form with an overt subject expression?
Example: hyö rua-tah;3PL work.IPS.PRS;they work;

Name: Can third person plural verb forms be used for impersonal reference?
Can second person singular verb forms be used in generic meaning?
Example: Tahto-ne-t hyvin eli-ä, pidä-y äijy ruadu-a;want-POT-2SG well live-INF need-3SG much work-INF;If you want to live well you need to work much;

Name: Are clauses with only infinitive predicates possible?
Can verbs in purposive subordinate clauses be in bare infinitive form?
Example: Halgu-o ei ole perti-s päčči-e lämmit-tiä;wood_log-PRT NEG be.CNG house-INE stove-PRT heat-INF;In the house there is no wood to heat the stove;

Name: Are there sentences without overt verbal arguments (e.g. weather verbs)?
Example: Vihmu-u;rain-3SG;It is raning;

Name: Is copula needed for predicate nominals in the 3rd person form of the present tense?
Example: Häi on čoma;3SG be.3SG beautiful;She is beautiful;

Name: Is a copula needed for predicate nominals in the past and/or future tense?
Example: Häi ol-i čoma;3SG be-PST.3SG beautiful;She was beautiful;

Name: Can locative adverbial phrases act as predicates without a copula?
Can the same coordinating conjunction be used for NPs, VPs, and clauses?
Comment: The respective coordinating conjunction is da 'and'.

Name: Does existential negation have a separate operator?
Can standard negation be asymmetric in the present tense?
Example: minä ellendä-n :  minä e-n ellendä;1SG understand-1SG : NEG-1SG understand.CNG;1SG understand : I don't understand;

Name: Can non-finite dependent clauses use the standard negation construction?
Is there a special negator that combines with non-finite forms?
Are there special negative non-finite forms?
Example: Lähti iäre sanu-a sano-ma-ttah;go.PST.3SG away word-PRT say-SUP-ABE;S/he went away without saying a word;

Name: Is there an impersonal passive construction?
Example: Tiä ele-täh hyvin;here live-IPS.PRS well;Here (people) live well;

Name: Are there nonfinite forms specialized on the relativization of particular core participants, e.g. subjects (S/A), direct objects (P), absolutive participants (S/P)?
Example: lug-ii poigu;read-ACT.PRS.PTCP boy;a reading boy;|lugie-ttu kniigu;read-PASS.PST.PTCP book;a book that has been read;

Name: Are there nonfinite forms that can relativize at least all core participants (S/A/P) and possibly also some noncore participants, e.g. locative adverbials, instruments, etc.?
Are there nonfinite forms that can relativize at least some noncore participants, e.g. locative adverbials or instruments, but cannot relativize all or some of the core participants, e.g. subjects?
Is there a specialized negative participial form, which cannot be analyzed as a specific participial marker + negation marker?
Is there a future participle?
Are there participles that can encode their subject by possessive suffixes?
Can subject in at least some participial subordinate clauses be encoded in the same way as in independent clauses?
Are there participles that obligatorily agree with the nouns they modify in case and number (in all contexts)?
Example: pala-nuo-s mečä-s;burn- forest-INE;in a burned forest;

Name: Are there nonfinite forms that can be used both as participles and action nominalizations?
Are there nonfinite forms that can be used both as participles and agentive nominalizations?
Example: opasta-i;teach-NMLZ;teacher, teaching;

Name: Are there nonfinite forms that can be used both as participles and converbs without any additional morphological material, such as case markers?
Is OV the neutral order in affirmative imperative clauses?
Example: Kirjuta kirjaine sizäre-lle-s;write.IMP.2SG letter sister-ALL-POSS.2SG;Write a letter to your sister!;
Comment: The neutral word order is VO.

Name: Is it possible to place an object between the negative marker and the main verb in imperative constructions?
Example: Älä tä-dä kniigu-a luve;NEG.IMP.2SG this-PRT book-PRT read.CNG;Don't read this book (but read another one)!;
Comment: It is possible only if the object is stressed/in focus, e.g.

Name: Are there preverbs?
Are there verbal prefixes?
Is there diminutive (hypocoristic) marking on verbs?
Can modifiers of action nominalization in agent and patient roles both be marked like possessors?
Example: tytö-n peze-mine/peze-ndy kest-i čuasu-n;girl-GEN wash-NMLZ/wash-NMLZ take-PST.3SG hour-GEN;washing the girl, the washing done by the girl took an hour;

Name: Can the modifier of action nominalization in patient role (e.g. "drinking of coffee") be marked like the direct object?
Example: runo-n kirjuta-ndu/kirjuta-mine;poem-GEN write-NMLZ/write-NMLZ;the poem writing;|kirjuta-n runo-n;write-1SG poem-GEN;I'll write a poem;

Name: Do core adjectives agree with the subject noun in number in the predicative position?
Example: Päivä-t ol-lah pit-kät;day-PL be-IPS.PRS long-PL;The days are long;

Name: Is it possible to form synthetic superlative?
Example: korge-vin puu;tall-SPRL tree;the tallest tree;

Name: Can adpositions have person/number marking?
Comment: The possessive suffixes are only used in a limited context (e.g. with kinship terms).

Name: Are there separate adpositions to express goal, source, and location (without there being syncretism)?
Comment: The postposition expressing 'under' differs for goal, location, and source: alle (under.ALL), al (under.ADE), alpäi (under.ABL).

Name: Is case compounding possible?
Comment: Although it is possible to add -päi in certain cases (e.g. školalpäi), such examples are not included here as -päi is no case marker on its own.

Name: Are there case categories only found in pronouns?
Does the numeral modification of a noun have an effect on its case selection?
Example: yksi lapsi : viizi lastu;one.NOM child.NOM : five.NOM child.PRT;one child : five children;

Name: Is the singular form of the noun also used with numerals bigger than 1?
Example: yksi lapsi : viizi lastu;one.NOM child.NOM.SG : five.NOM child.PRT.SG;one child : five children;

Name: Is there a genitive case that has an affix?
Example: tuata-n kodi;father-GEN home;father's home;

Name: Is there a dative case used to express indirect object/receiver/goal (different from a local case)?
Is there a terminative case?
Comment: A postpositional construction is used instead.

Name: Is there a separate case to indicate without what/who an action takes place / does not take place?
Example: denga-ttah;money-ABE;without money;

Name: Is there a separate case to mark the motion along or by the referent of the noun (prolative)?
Example: Myö tul-i-mmo kodi-h mečä-či;1PL come-PST-1PL home-ILL forest-PROL;We came home through/via the forest;

Name: Is there a locative case that marks goal?
Example: Lapse-t mennä-h škola-h;child-PL go-IPS.PRS school-ILL;The children are going to school;

Name: Is there a locative case that marks location?
Comment: Location and source are marked the same way.

Name: Is there a locative case that marks source?
Example: Nosta takki lattie-lpäi;take_up.IMP.2SG jacket floor-ABL;Take the jacket up from the floor;
Comment: In addition to the suffix -l also -lpäi may be used.

Name: Is there case syncretism of goal and location marking?
Is there case syncretism of location and source marking?
Example: lattie-l;floor-ALL/ADE;on the floor, from the floor;

Name: Are there two sets of local cases?
Comment: There are external and internal local cases.

Name: Is there a third set of local cases?
Is there a separate case for marking the means by which something is carried out (instrumental) and/or accompaniement (comitative)?
Example: Egläi velle-nke ol-i-mmo siene-s;yesterday brother-COM be-PST-1PL muschroom-INE;Yesterday, together with brother, we were picking musrooms;

Name: Is there a separate case for marking accompaniment, which is different from the instrumental?
Is there a separate case for marking the result of change (translative) and/or a state of being (essive)?
Example: Se naine jä-i leske-kse;this woman remain-PST.3SG widow-TRA;This woman became a widow;

Name: Is there a separate case for marking the state of being (essive), which is different from the translative?
Example: Sizär ruada-u opastaja-nnu;sister work-3SG teacher-ESS;(My) sister is working as a teacher;

Name: Is there a separate morphological marker for expressing equative meaning?
Is there an inflectional nominal marker for expressing benefactive or destinative semantics independent from the dative?
Is there in addition to the basic declension a declension different from a possessive declension?
Is it possible to use singular with paired body parts/clothing/accessories that accompany them?
Can the marking of the possessor in the attributive construction vary?
Can the possessor in the attributive construction be marked with the nominative?
Comment: Possessor is marked with the genitive.

Name: Is non-singular possession marked in the possessive declension?
Can 2Sg possessive suffix be used to mark definiteness?
Can 3Sg possessive suffix be used to mark definiteness?
Is there animacy distinction in independent interrogative pronouns?
Example: ken;;who;|mi;;what;

Name: When used as a relative pronoun, is it common to use 'who' for animates other than humans?
When used as a relative pronoun, is it common to use 'who' for inanimates?
Can a demonstrative stem be used in the function of a pronoun with 3rd person singular human referent?
Is the order of possessive suffix and case suffix across the paradigm the same?
Example: eči-n tytär-dä-ni;look_for-1SG daugther-PRT-POSS.1SG;I'm looking for my daughter;
Comment: The possessive suffix follows the case suffix.

Name: Is the order of number and case suffixes fixed across the paradigm the same?
Example: kaži-loi-nke;cat-PL-COM;with cats;
Comment: The order is number + case marker.

Name: Are there different words for mother’s brother and father’s brother?
Are there different words for younger and older relative for other relations than siblings?
Is there animacy distinction for both concepts 'new/young' and 'old'?
Is there distinction for both 'warm' and 'cold' based on whether referring to weather or to temperature of objects?
Is there contrastive length of consonants?
Example: kanan [ˈka.nan] hen.GEN.SG vs. kannan [ˈkan.nan] heel.GEN.SG

Name: Is there contrastive length of vowels?
Example: tuli [ˈtu.lʲiˑ] ‘fire’ vs. tuuli [ˈtuː.lʲi]  ‘wind’

Name: Is there contrast between short and long unstressed vowels?
Example: puhu [ˈpu.huˑ] 'blowing, gust' vs. puhuu [ˈpu.huː] blow.PRS.3SG

Name: Is there contrast in duration of geminate consonants?
Are there more than two phonological quantities?
Are there extralong syllables?
Example: juokso [ˈjuok.so] 'running', juoksii [ˈjuok.siː] 'runner'

Name: Is the main foot structure trochaic?
Example: kana [ˈka.naˑ] ’hen’

Name: Is there lexically distinctive word stress?
Is there morphologically conditioned stress?
Example: hyppeämine [ˈhyp.peæˌmi.ne] 'jumping'

Name: Is there fixed primary stress?
Example: kana [ˈka.naˑ] 'hen'

Name: Is there stress in heavy syllables?
Is there non-initial primary stress?
Is there palatal vowel harmony?
Example: eländy [ˈe.læn.dy] 'life', ötönöi [ˈø.tø.nøi] 'snail', väzymys [ˈvæ.zy.mys] 'tiredness'

Name: Is there velar vowel harmony?
Is there labial vowel harmony?
Are there rising diphthongs?
Example: seiny [ˈsei.ny] 'wall'

Name: Are there lowering diphthongs?
Example: ruadua [ˈrua.dua] work.INF

Name: Is there qualitative contrast between subsets of short and long vowels?
Are there full vs. reduced vowels as contrastive subsets?
Is there front high rounded vowel ü [y]?
Example: seiny [ˈsei.ny] 'wall'

Name: Is there front midhigh rounded vowel ö [ø]?
Example: pöly [ˈpø.lyˑ] 'dust'

Name: Is there back high unrounded vowel ï [ɯ]?
Is there back midhigh unrounded vowel ë [ɤ]?
Is there back low round vowel [ɒ]?
Is there contrast between low and mid front vowels (ä [æ] vs. e [e])?
Example: päre [ˈpæ.re] ‘pine splinter’, pereh [ˈpe.reh] ‘family’

Name: Are there word-initial consonant clusters?
Example: klakku [ˈklak.ku] 'wisp, bunch', stauttšu [ˈstaut.t͡ʃu] 'bowl'

Name: Are there word-internal consonant clusters in syllable onset?
Are there consonant clusters in syllable coda?
Example: hursti [ˈhurs.tʲi] '(linen) fabric, towel, carpet'

Name: Are there clusters of three or more consonants in a word between vowels?
Example: hursti [ˈhurs.tʲi] '(linen) fabric, towel, carpet'

Name: Are there word-final clusters of three or more consonants?
Are there palatalized dentals?
Example: pal´l´as [ˈpalʲ.lʲas] 'naked', vil'l'u [ˈvilʲ.lʲu] 'wool'

Name: Are there palatalized labials and velars?
Is there palatal stop [c]?
Is there palatal nasal [ɲ]?
Is there palatal lateral [ʎ]?
Is there phonemic velar nasal [ŋ]?
Is there dental affricate [t͡s]?
Is there non-alveolar affricate (e.g. [t͡ʃ], [͡cɕ])?
Example: čakku [ˈt͡ʃak.ku] 'gnat, mosquito'

Name: Is there a phonological contrast between [s] and postalveolar sibilant [ʃ]?
Are there voiced plosives [b, g, d]?
Example: hebo [ˈhe.boˑ] 'horse'

Name: Is there glottal stop [ˀ]?
Is there phonological contrast between plain and labial velar consonants (e.g. [k] vs. [kʷ])?
Is there a constraint on word-initial r?
Is there laryngeal fricative [h]?
Example: raha [ˈra.haˑ] 'money'

Name: Is there voiced velar fricative [ɣ]?
Is there voiceless velar fricative [x]?
Is there voiced dental fricative [ð]?
Is there phonemic labio-velar approximant [w]?
Is there voiceless labiodental fricative [f]?
Is there radical qualitative consonant gradation?
Example: paidu [ˈpai.du] 'shirt' vs. pajjad [ˈpaj.jad] 'shirts'

Name: Is there quantitative consonant gradation?
Example: sukku [ˈsuk.ku] 'stocking' vs. sukat [ˈsu.kat] 'stockings'
